skill.name: gene-database
skill.description: Query NCBI Gene via E-utilities/Datasets API. Search by symbol/ID, retrieve gene info (RefSeqs, GO, locations, phenotypes), batch lookups, for gene annotation and functional analysis.
skill.summary: Query NCBI Gene database for gene symbols, IDs, sequences, annotations, and functional data using official APIs.
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate bioinformatics tool for querying NCBI Gene database. All static findings are false positives: markdown backticks are code formatting (not shell execution), API keys are user-provided CLI arguments (not hardcoded secrets), and hardcoded URLs are official NCBI API endpoints. No data exfiltration or malicious patterns detected.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:34
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown backtick syntax for code formatting, not Ruby shell execution. Line 34 references 'scripts/query_gene.py' in documentation context.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at references/api_reference.md:20
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Markdown code block formatting showing URL, not executable code. This is API documentation for E-utilities endpoint.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: env_access: Generic API/secret keys at scripts/query_gene.py:23
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: api_key is an optional CLI argument (args.api_key), not hardcoded secret. Users provide their own NCBI API key for rate limiting.
URL points to official NCBI E-utilities endpoint (eutils.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov). This is expected and legitimate for a gene database tool.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: filesystem: Python file write/append at scripts/batch_gene_lookup.py:287
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: User-specified output file for batch results. Legitimate functionality with proper error handling, not malicious file operations.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at references/api_reference.md:3
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Scanner flagged MD5/SHA references in documentation. These are standard checksum/hash algorithm references in bioinformatics, not security vulnerabilities.
Standard gene ID iteration and data extraction from API responses, not system reconnaissance. This is normal bioinformatics data processing.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: obfuscation: DANGEROUS COMBINATION: Code execution + Network + Credential access
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: This is standard API client behavior for a bioinformatics tool. Network requests to NCBI APIs with optional user-provided API key is legitimate and expected pattern. No exfiltration or malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Access comprehensive gene data from NCBI including sequences, annotations, and functional information. Search by gene symbol, ID, or biological context to retrieve RefSeqs, Gene Ontology, chromosomal locations, and phenotypes for bioinformatics research.
actual_capabilities: Search NCBI Gene by symbol, name, or ID across species
Retrieve gene sequences, RefSeqs, and metadata via official APIs
Fetch Gene Ontology annotations and phenotype associations
Process batch gene lookups with rate limiting and error handling
Output data in JSON, XML, or text formats
Query by chromosomal location, disease, or pathway
limitations: Rate limited to 3 requests per second without API key
Only accesses NCBI Gene database, not other genomic resources
No built-in data analysis or visualization capabilities
Requires internet connection to access NCBI APIs

use_cases.title: Gene annotation workflows
use_cases.description: Retrieve comprehensive gene data including sequences, GO terms, and phenotypes for functional analysis.

use_cases.title: Batch gene data collection
use_cases.description: Process gene lists efficiently with rate limiting for large-scale genomic studies.

use_cases.title: Gene information lookup
use_cases.description: Query gene symbols and retrieve detailed information for educational purposes.

prompt_templates.title: Find a gene symbol
prompt_templates.prompt: Find information about the {gene_symbol} gene in {organism} including its chromosomal location and function.

prompt_templates.title: Get sequence data
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve RefSeq accession numbers and gene sequence data for {gene_id} in JSON format.

prompt_templates.title: Batch gene lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up gene information for the following genes from {organism}: {gene_list}. Return the results as JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Gene function search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find genes associated with {biological_process} in {organism} using Gene Ontology terms.

output_examples.input: Find information about BRCA1 in human

best_practices: Include the organism in your query to avoid ambiguous results from gene symbols that exist in multiple species
Use Gene IDs instead of symbols when precision is required, as gene symbols can change over time
Include your NCBI API key for faster batch processing (up to 10 requests per second)
anti_patterns: Do not make individual requests in a loop without rate limiting, as this will trigger NCBI rate limits
Do not rely solely on gene symbols for permanent storage, as official nomenclature can change
Do not assume all gene symbols are unique within an organism without verifying

faq.question: How do I get an NCBI API key?
faq.answer: Register for a free API key at https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account to increase rate limits from 3 to 10 requests per second.

faq.question: What gene formats are supported?
faq.answer: You can search by official gene symbol (BRCA1), Gene ID (672), or use complex queries with GO terms and disease keywords.

faq.question: Can I retrieve protein sequences?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill retrieves RefSeq accessions for transcripts and proteins associated with the gene.

faq.question: How many genes can I query at once?
faq.answer: The batch script supports hundreds of genes with automatic rate limiting. ESummary accepts up to 500 IDs per request.

faq.question: What output formats are available?
faq.answer: Data can be returned as JSON for programmatic use, XML for detailed metadata, or human-readable text summaries.

faq.question: Does this skill store any data?
faq.answer: No, this skill only queries NCBI APIs in real-time. All data is returned directly to the user or written to a user-specified output file.
